text: I stumbled upon this restaurant while headed to a business meeting. I am glad that I did! The food was awesome! I ordered pancakes, hash browns, grits (which I'm very picky about) and bacon. You can taste that everything is made from scratch. I ahould mention that the prices and portions are spot on too. Patty was my server. She was very warm and friendly. I'll be bringing my husband back to check it out! :) Excellent food and great service!

We have been working in Vegas for several months and tried just about every diner off the strip and this one is our absolute favorite. We come here every morning to drink our tea and eat breakfast. The staff is fantastic and everyone is so nice. Brian, one of the owners always greets people on the weekends and makes everyone feel welcome. The food Is just like it came from your grandma's kitchen and their house made jam is amazing. The decor is my favorite part of the whole diner, it is filled with antiques and nic nacs and there is not a bare spot on the wall.

We went exploring to find a little breakfast diner and found Lou's Diner! Patty immediately greeted us! Service was fantastic and the food is great! Jam is homemade, we devoured the mixed berry!  Thanks Patty for the great experience! We will definitely be back!
Great breakfast place with wonderful Grits.  Lunch special on Fridays is Chicken and dumplings made the old fashion way.  Good service, down home charm.

Really good place. Came here with my Grandfather. The food is really good. Loved the French Toast and the Root Beer floats are AMAZING. The A/C was out but the owner and servers made every attempt to keep them in.  Really good ownership and business. Will defiantly go there again for good homemade food.

We must have gone on the wrong day!  We read all the reviews and were very excited about good diner food. Our food was below average. The eggs tasted like someone spilled flour on them. The side potatoes had no seasoning--no salt. No pepper. Bland.  Corned beef hash is from a can. The cinnamon roll seemed a few days old then reheated in the microwave.  The biscuits and gravy were ok but lacked meat in the gravy. The sour dough toast tasted more like a dried out crouton. The waitresses were pleasant and the bacon was crispy.

Got there around 1pm for lunch. Lots of choices in the menu. Food was hot and very flavorful. Restaurant sits back off the road, but glad we stopped in. Food appears to be homemade ( nothing out of a can).  Would definitely recommend! Priced fairly too!!
Great Food & Excellent Service! Highly recommend for breakfast. Found they place on Yelp.

My son & I were hungry around 11:30 am on a much needed lazy Sat morning, found Lou's Diner on Yelp, decided to give it a try. Placed a togo order with the pick up app, we ordered the ham steak & eggs with extra crispy hash browns & sd toast, and the Brad's Burrito with no green sauce & a non-toasted bagel. Our order was ready in about 20 mins, just long enough to get dressed & drive there which was a nice bonus. The staff was friendly & the place was almost empty. The food was hot and tasted good. I was bummed that they gave me white bread instead of sd & the hash browns were not crispy but the rest of the food was yummy. We will definitely go here again, maybe dine in.
If you like the home town cafe feel, and the made by Grandma taste, Lou's is the place! Will go back very soon, again!

We found Lou's on a recent trip to Vegas and ended up eating breakfast there every day. The owner and staff made us feel like family; the food was great and it came out fast. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town.

We have been trying different breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas for years. We found  on Yelp that this one serves grits. So, we tried it out and in the words of my wife "Awesome Grits!"  My omelet was also excellent.

The restaurant is a little hard to find - its on the east side of decatur behind a Walgreens on Decatur and Mayflower Lane.  Well worth the visit.
We love this place!! Amazing food. Great coffee. Reasonable prices. What more can you ask for we will never go to ihop again.

A great old fashioned diner with good food, reasonable prices and attentive service.  

We had the typical diner food of half a tuna melt which was on the senior menu.  My husband had fish and chips which was large enough to take home for an extra meal.  Both meals were tasty.   We also had a delicious warm piece of blueberry pie with ice cream.  

Go here when you want to take a trip down memory lane.

All I can say if your looking for a place that has that old school diner feel then this is your place.  I'm sure I'm dating myself but if you remember the TV show Alice and Mel's Diner it has that feel to it.  I've been in Vegas for 23 years and I wish I would of none about this place back then.  There is new owners Brian and Julie and they have not change anything they preserved everything the way it was for the past 40 years.  Very nice couple Julie makes all the cakes and pies home made.  The food is great the waitresses are super friendly Lisa , Rena, Patti and Linda and there are others also and there all good.  Besides the people that run it I have met so many nice people that are loyal customers I sit at the counter eat breakfast read the paper drink coffee and chit chat with everyone just a great place I'm a previous restaurant owner of different restaurant and can be quite a critic on restaurants and give this one thumbs up.

Lou's Diner. We stopped in for breakfast. It was crowded but we had no wait. Quite friendly wait staff. I cannot remember the owners name, but he was in greeting customers and conversing. From what I have been told, this is the norm.
DÃ©cor is diner-ish. Surrounding walls had old antique knick-knacks. Very interesting diner with good food and a good family feel.

I must say that I really like Lou's Diner. They have delicious breakfast food and a great lunch menu. They also sell homemade jam by the jar. Lou's is also well priced. Two people can eat a wonderful breakfast and walk out of there for less than twenty bucks. They've been around for a long time and they've proven why. Love It!

It was solid. Not amazing, just solid.
Is the food worth the price? Absolutely. Would I go again? If I was in the area. Would I go out of my way to come here on a Saturday morning? I'm afraid no.
Great comfort food, clean and the best service. Will make you feel right at home! Even their jelly on toast is so damn good

First time here.   Server was so freindly.  Cinnamon roll is rated to 5 of my life.   Chicken fried steak was great with great gravy.  Only complaint would be the bisquit oon my wifrs meal was a little dry.  Raspberry jam was great.   We will be back.   Thank you.
Definitely a local spot, tasty food quick service,  great prices. Bottomless cups of coffee.

Great small town, everyone knows your name diner. Food was delicious and staff was friendly when you immediately walk in the door. It's such a nice change of pace eatery in a town with smoke filled buffets. I will be back next time I'm in town. Thank you Lou's Diner!
I was craving a great breakfast. We decided on Lou's. It was our first visit. We weren't disappointed! Food was great! Service was fabulous. We'll definitely be back!

I pass by this restaurant each day on my way to work. Today, My son and I decided to finally stop and give it a try. The minute we entered the dining room, we were greeted with a smile by the friendly staff. I thought to myself "This is a good sign". I opted for breakfast ( which is served all day) and ordered the skillet breakfast. Two eggs, over medium, breakfast potatoes, and bacon. Very tasty.  My son had the crispy fish sandwich and french fries. It looked delicious and he thought it was very good. We both ordered homemade cake to go. Triple chocolate and the last piece of lemon! All in all, the food was just ok. The reason I will be returning is for the exceptional service we received. The employees were very attentive and friendly. I look forward to returning and sampling more options on their menu.

Visiting Vegas and looking for a local breakfast diner.  I didn't want a casino type buffet. Someplace where I can park and walk in without spending too much time or having to ride an elevator.  After searching around, we found Lou's with overall very good write ups.  They didn't disappoint. Casual relaxing diner.  Good food, great service!  Primarily locals and overall a comfy place to have breakfast at.  Will be back.

Jus Had Chicken & Dumplings At Lou's Diner across from Arizona Charlies Decatur!!!! So Yummy!!!! Jus Like Home in Louisiana!!!   Behind Walgreens. So Good!!!! Good Soup Too!!!! Homemade Lunch & Breakfast Specials Everyday!!!!-- feeling happy.
The food was good and there was a lot of it, and the prices were excellent. The server was nice, the bathroom was nice and clean.

I've been here several times over the last few years and I gotta tell you, Lou's does breakfast right.  The place is located in a little side strip mall and if you weren't looking for it you would probbly miss the joint.

I've really ever only been to Lou's for breakfast, but man do they know how to make breakfast.  The waitresses are usually quite prompt with greetingsand they almost immediately take your drink order and offer you a menu.

I am a big time breakfast eater and Lou's really make my belly feel all warm inside.  I don't have a favorite item on the menu, but I have probably tried them all.  I suppose you can't go wrong with biscuits and gravy.  I'm talking about real fresh buttermilk biscuits and homemade brown gravy underneath a some fresh scrambled eggs and cheese and you're in heaven.

Lou's is not expensive and it certainly isn't some posh, uppity location.  The place is clean and the food is delicious.  What more can one ask for!

Wonderful food and service. If you go a few times waitress remembers your drinks even. Kind of like Cheers TV show. Great food, excellent prices for everything, and very interesting decor. Try it. You will be hooked.

If you're looking for the best hidden gem in Vegas diners, this is it. It's straight up old school beautiful. The decor is eclectic, the food is great, the wait staff friendly. The even make their own jelly for your toast. I took a chance and now can't wait to go back.

Whenever I miss grandma's house, I go here. Comfort food and knick knacks beyond my heart's desire. Genuinely sassy waitresses float around with hot plates stacked on their arms. 

Daily specials for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
Excellent food. Julie's favorite is very good. Has great breakfast and lunch. Very friendly and welcoming staff.
Great simple and very cozy ambience.  Service was wonderful. The food was great and price very reasonably. Would highly recommend. Way to go !

The service was good and helpful. My biscuits & gravy were good. It's pretty much my favorite breakfast food, so I'm very picky when it comes to that. The gravy tasted homemade & creamy with a perfect amount of seasoning. I also had the pancake, which wasn't bad, but the plain ones kind of taste the same. Last, I got the chocolate cake to go. It was absolutely delicious and the best I've had in a while!

The best things comes in small packages; Lou's diner is not big but they sure do bring out large flavors in their food. Eating at Lou's..I never left home! Please don't just look in the window, go inside and experience the atmosphere the service and the great food, they will make you a part of their family!

Over the last couple months I've been bouncing back and forth between the recently purchased new abode and the old house that's currently in escrow.  Numerous meetings with contractors at the new place, back to the old place to meet realtors, contractors, inspectors, blah blah blah.  A few weeks back I decided every time I have to be at the new place to meet a contractor, after the meeting i'll hit a breakfast place.

It's been ages since I've been to Lou's so I decided to include it on my breakfast place list.

Place looks exactly like it did when I tried it over 4 years ago.  I believe the cook was the same ( is it Lou ? ) 

Ordered ham steak, eggs o/e, rye toast.  I believe it was $8.  I expected a lower price given low rent district, presumably low overhead given nothing has changed in the place in over 4 years, so maybe the serving size is ala hash house a go go , uhhhhh, that's a negatory

Food was average - a little too much oil puddling on the eggs but not a big deal given the grease in the hash browns.

Probably closer to 2.5 stars but I round up given the place for so dang long - props to them.

Such a nice sit down place. Items are not expensive at all and there's fun stuff to look at on all the walls. TIP if you want a fun mug to sip your coffee from rather than the typical diner mug, just ask your waitress when you order your hot beverage! They have specials for each meal and fresh baked desserts everyday. If you come around enough the staff WILL remember you and it's like a little family in there.
I typically go after church on Sundays with my Aunt and it can be a little busy but always worth the wait (although there rarely is one).  I love the vibe of not only the staff but the type of customers this diner attracts.

Just returned from Las Vegas and got the information on this diner via Yelp. Tried it the first day, then ate there for every day that we were there. The menu has a lot of items and the portions were good, for me. The taste for the items I ate were good, but their special chicken noodle soup was the best. The waitresses were polite, courteous and efficient - excellent service. Will be recommending this place to all my friends from Hawaii.

Came for breakfast the other day, had my car in a shop. My friend, and her family met me and we decided to get some breakfast nearby. Superb customer service! She went out of her way to find some coloring pages and crayons for V. I wish I could remember her name...but whole place had a fantastic mom n pop feel. I got a breakfast skillet with sausage. It was delish and filling. I love the regulars that put the tables together and just hang out for the morning. Definitely a place to revisit with my own kids. Thank you for making my visit so memorable, will def be coming back soon

If you're looking for an old-school breakfast place that's like eating at grandma's, look no further than Lou's Diner. This kitschy kitchen has all the breakfast staples along with a sizeable lunch menu. But today, like always, it was breakfast for us.

I ordered a hot link with eggs (over hard), home fries, and wheat toast. My husband got his usual order of ham steak and eggs (over easy), hash browns, and sourdough toast. My food was fine -- nothing special -- but my husband raved about his meal.

Our server was great. When we got there, they were slammed, and she made sure to let us know she'd be over as soon as she could. She promptly refilled our drinks and didn't leave us waiting on our bill.

As I said, the decor is decidedly kitschy, with copious cookie jars and coffee mugs throughout. It's not fine dining, but it's one of the finer breakfast joints I've been to in Vegas. If you're into diner food, give Lou's a try.

This place is wonderful. They have a varied menu of foods with very reasonable prices. The portions are large and the food tasted amazing! The staff are so friendly and welcoming and they constantly check on you. It has a very welcoming Atmosphere. I will be returning here again and again!!!!
First timers and already we feel like regulars. The owner is very friendly and makes you feel like one of the family. AMAZING FOOD!! Good vibes and the perfect diner feel. We highly recommend it!

My senior residents recommended this place and I'd have to say, the server, Linda, is very friendly! The environment is definitely of a diner, very "home-y"! Food fairly priced and excellent quality! 5/5 would recommend!!! 
Update, all the servers are extremely friendly, I've tried something different every time I come and I'm never disappointed!! The food is fairly priced and out of this work delicious!!!

I've never gone back to the same place twice on the same Vegas trip but this place is SO good you'll want it every morning!!! 

Sweet cream pancakes are so fluffy and good... the homemade jam was addicting and I wanted to lick the bowl... the scrambled eggs were so good even my daughter that never eats wanted to order her own plate... and the turkey sausage is super yummy. 

The staff is so nice, the guy even brought my daughter her own wooden toy car to keep!!!

Very cool old diner feel. Very friendly staff. Great coffee.  I had the biscuits & gravy with a side of grits. Both were very good & you get big portions (I have leftovers for later). My husband had chicken fried steak with hash browns & it was also very good. We will be back :/)

Came in to meet a friend for breakfast and this is a nice, hometown country feeling place. Made me forget I was in Vegas for a second with all of the knick knacks and decor. Lou's has a good menu selection, tasty, generously sized portions and fair prices. Popular, busy local diner with lots of friendly wait staff.

I drove past this diner when visiting Pop's last week, and somehow it stuck in my mind enough to suggest it for breakfast this morning. Pulled it up on Yelp and looked through the recommended dishes, then headed out at 7AM, right when they opened.

BF and I sat at the bar and were helped by a sweet older lady. We sat right next to an amazing-looking butter pecan cake, but chose not to try it this visit. I'm slightly regretting it now, since it looked and sounded amazing, but I can't do sugar that early in the morning.

Bar was set with plenty of local papers to browse through, which we did after placing our orders: the chili cheese omelet with a side of homefries (as per so many recommendations here on Yelp!) and the lunch special of the day (available even at bfast hours!) of tuna sandwich and chicken noodle soup. 

Service was friendly and attentive without overbearing, which is a careful balance when sitting at the bar anywhere, and food was out quick. Omelet was oozing with melted American cheese, and the homefries were on the plain side but had a good crispiness to them- the side mixed well with the omelet and chili sauce.
The tuna sandwich was very basic but nothing to complain about; the soup was downright delicious with noodles that tasted homemade and a broth that was complex and seemed to have been cooked down for a long time.

All the food had a good homecooked taste to it, and it was a nice laid-back morning with my guy and the paper. What more can I ask for that early on a Sunday?

Never heard of Lou's until recently.  It is practically hidden in plain site on one of the busiest streets in Vegas.   I was told it was "old school" and I was excited to try it.

Came in for breakfast on a Friday morning and our group was initially set upon by obvious regulars poking in good fun at us.

The waitress was very friendly and explained away whatever question was fired off at her by the group.  For the remainder of our meal she never let the coffee run empty or cold.

We all ordered something that had gravy poured on it.  Not brown gravy but the southern kind that sticks to the ribs.  A field test was conducted and a utensil was inserted into said gravy and then inverted where it seemed to defy gravity by clinging to the implement.

My meal of choice was "The Haystack."  It was a bed of hash browns, eggs, cheese smothered above goodness.  For added stress on the arteries two pieces of bacon were placed on each side.

So filling was the meal, lunch or anything else was not required the rest of the day.

I don't know why this place gets 4 1/2 stars. My experience was disappointing, particularly because I chose this place after visiting Yelp to research good diners in town. First of all, when you walk in, it looks like they chose someone's grandmother with tacky taste to decorate the place. Secondly, the energy in there feels dead, even when the diner is filled with patrons. Thirdly, the drinks we were served tasted like they've traveled through moldy pipes. Fourthly, it's located in a weird place. And lastly (and most importantly) the breakfast we ate tasted like someone who doesn't cook, cooked it. The meal alone was a 2/5. Honestly, my mother could have cooked us a better breakfast. I give it an overall 3/5 because at least they're trying.

I am very disappointed in this place, first time here and with all the good reviews i was interested.  I ordered chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes, my wife is from Texas and wanted a sunday fried steak.  The mashed potatoes were brown and bland! The chicken fried steak was balnd and dry, and vegggies a can of veg all.  I paid good money for one order.  I hate to give bad reviews but for the price i paid I couldn't not say anything, the potatoes were not edible. However, they had cake that was good skiped the meal and ate the cake no good, gravy was balnd also

I'm writing this review assuming that if your restaurant is called "Lou's Diner," you're seeking to provide a classic American diner experience -- and if you're thinking of eating here, that fits the bill for you. On this basis, Lou's gets 5 stars.

I am a local resident who has been coming here a couple-few times a year for 15 years. The food is very good and always comes out hot. Special requests are greeted with, "We'll be happy to do that." The service is outstanding and friendly. And... the check is always reasonable.

(Note:  Brian, the new owner, took over from the original owner, Lou, not long ago. As a customer who loves Lou's just the way it was, I was happy to see that Brian didn't change much -- and the things that changed were for the better. Like...

Free Wi-Fi.

:-)

I want to say the place has a old dusty charm to it. Like the old syle diners this place is pretty decent and you get a decent meal for the reasonable money you are charged. Nothing spectaucular here but it is a breakfast place you can go to without a bunch of regrets like I have had at some places.

Fun, old school diner. Vintage, retro signs, kitchen gear and decor hang around the seating area, which could use another upgrade, but it does add to the charm. We enjoyed the food and the experience, but it might be just a bit too old school for us. There is nothing wrong with kicking the cooking skills up a notch after all these years but they seem to still be doing okay, so what the hell. I doubt it we will be back though. 

Worth stopping in to check out and maybe find an old favorite like mom or grandma made, or to invoke some memories of family times.  

The family member servers were pleasant but clearly had no problem talking about new customers after they left, which I sadly overheard. It did leave a bad taste in my mouth, which the food could not cover up. 

There are many things they could do that would build up their check sales also. Like asking customers if they would like dessert instead of dropping the bill on the table five minutes after their food is delivered. (Pet Peeve) . I was looking forward to a slice of the chocolate cake advertised on the board and was never asked if I wanted anything else. So I went somewhere else and gave them money for my sweet tooth.
I absolutely love this place. My only breakfast option. I have my own coffee cup there and the coffee is great. Brian and Julie are awesome. I'm happy to have such a great place to take my family.
Found this place on Yelp with great reviews. Decided to give it a try and it totally lived up to the hype. Food was fantastic and prices are super low. Totally worth the short trip off the strip

I highly recommend Lou's Diner to anyone looking for a family friendly place to grab breakfast or lunch. Whether you're ordering online or going in for a sit-down meal, you won't be disappointed with the great food and amazing service at this hidden Las Vegas gem.

I'll keep it short and sweet.
My 14 year old son's tip: HOMEFRIES!! Country combo was best breakfast he's had in long time.(not sure what that says about my cooking)
Husband: chili & cheese omelette was decent, gravy needs "momma's touch"
Me: pork chop was delicious! Perfectly seasoned, and HOMEFRIES were spot-on.
We all agree that if we go back, it will be bc the chocolate cake is AMAZING!!!! (That is why it got 4 & not 3stars)

A perfect place for breakfast or a snack. We got our table quickly and our waiter was super fast at serving us. We got out coffee and soon after our bacon and eggs.

The manager was making sure everything was ok, and the staff seemed happy. Locals seemed to be regulars and that's a really good sign of quality to me.

See you all next July!

Been coming to Lou's off and on(live a considerable distance away) for the past 12 years or so. I was glad to see Lou's hasn't changed a bit and still serving good home cooked meals. If you are looking for a home cooked meal, and a cool vintage atmosphere, Lou's will not disappoint.

Absolutely phenomenal! Linda was our server and she was outstanding. The food was as great as the service. Patty was also serving today and she was also very friendly and willing to help. I can't say enough good things about Lou's. We are glad we found it. Thank you from your fellow restaurant owner. BacckBurner Family Resturant Prescott Valley AZ

From the moment we walked in the door, we felt the welcoming and homie atmosphere.  We were greeted immediately by the owner and friendly staff!  Linda was the nicest server and was so attentive.  The food was great and so comforting, and we are so glad we came here!  The wait at Egg and I was too long, so we decided to give this place a try, and we are so glad we did. We will definitely come back here every chance we get. We left with such a great feeling and a slice of homemade hummingbird cake!  We couldn't have asked for a better experience.  Thank u

Lou's has become our go to place for a good "comfort food" meal. Love the feel, the staff, friendly owner and old fashioned diner food. The only thing I can knock is the corn beef hash as feeling as if its not made in house. Everything else we've had so far has been worth it.

Home away from home! Recently moved out from Phoenix to Las Vegas and found this gem right down the street from me. The staff here is amazing! Everyone greets you with a smile. I've had the pleasure of being served by Linda and she is an absolute doll! Breakfast, lunch, or just for the coffee, the food here is amazing!! I also met Brian, which I believe is the owner of the establishment and he made me feel welcomed not only to the restaurant, but to the neighborhood and city! Looking forward to becoming a regular at Lou's Diner! Two thumbs up!!

I was referred to come here from one of my candidates and she did not lead me wrong. 

Everything minus the fried veal and biscuts are made in house and I mean everything. The chicken fried steak was breaded fresh with cube steak not that bs that you eat at other diners. The cake was made fresh, gravy, pie and everything else is made in house. 

I will be back and trying everything on the menu one by one. I really enjoyed the gravy, and jam omg the jam that is made in house. 

I am a new regular and couldnt be happier.
Found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out. Nice old school themed diner. Food was delicious. Our server Renee was nice and friendly. Give this place 5 stars.

Bottomless cup of coffee, the real deal Polish sausage as opposed to some charred micro-link at chain places, friendly and fast service, favorable price range for most items, and a genuine locals atmosphere make Lou's the local historical icon that it is. It's well hidden, located in yet-another strip mall, so this was only the second time I've been, but I do remember the first: in the third week after moving to Las Vegas two years ago. 

What did I have two years ago?  A crisp tuna melt. And a chocolate milkshake. All tasty. 

The food at Lou's is what you can make at home. Standard eggs, pancakes, cakes, sausage, grilled cheese, soup, French toast, you name it. So you're not paying for any outrageous culinary experience, but more for the comfort of home. And to escape the chain race.

I'm DONE with the IHOPs and Denny's of the area. Lou's has become my new nextdoor go-to joint for casual meets with friends in those early hours of the day. Consistent, tasteful, local.

Great place to eat if you're missing home made food, you get alot, definitely get what you pay for,  it could use a little more seasoning but it was good, everyone was very welcoming,  I would go back

Want eggs and bacon or any other diner staple? This is the place to visit, complete with hardcore, sound-like-they-just-moved-from-New-Jersey waitresses! Ask for Patty, she the one with the radiant blond hair. Food is diner delectable.

So my ex and I are still good friends and we both practice Dice Living in food, restaurants and travel (allowing a single 6 sided die to lead and guide a person in whatever area of their life they need a little adventure in)    :)

The die chose Lou's diner for breakfast.    We were a little concerned due to the area, its not the best in town and quite a drive from where we live in Enterprise but the die chose and you cant refuse an adventure!

We seated ourselves which I liked, a clean and comfortable booth and surveyed the place, memorbillia from the 50's and beyond, an old radio/tape player jukebox like the one my mom used to own, the plastic container where old fashioned diners used to (and still do here) put cake slices to entice customers...so neat!

Told the waitress Linda that we were new and she was excited to have us and make us regulars which I can say from this experience we will be going back SOON.    

The die instructed me to get a drink of my choice so I got a pepsi and the die wanted my ex to try a breakfast of the die's choice, it chose eggs and potatoes w/toast and ham, which we took home the ham for the dog once my ex took a mandatory bite.     

The food was excellent, the service was excellent, this place really should have 5 stars--oh one thing my ex said though, they should play old music on the radio, Nightranger was playing, need some old stuff, Elvis, Shangri Las, Del Shannon, etc...   

Oh!

I forgot the jelly!    Cherry jelly!    They have other flavors too, mixed berry is heaven as well and Strawberry!   Didnt try the other flavor and I dont remember what it was.    

Linda, on that business card I left, if you dont want to join yourself, please pass it on to someone else.  :)    Its all about spreading love, compassion, thankfullness, etc to others, bringing some happiness into someone else's life, Paying it forward in some way.    Thanks for a great first time experience!!

What can I say about this place....I'll start off by saying that I've had the privilege to eat at some beautiful places that are off the grid some good good food and then I ate here. I saw this little spot hidden spot I should say and decided to go here not knowing what to expect. At first it seemed like a mistake coming in here. Then I saw the menu ordered the Ruben sandwich...... I bring my family every time they come from out of town this is the place to come. The food is the best food next to my mother's food. Its delicious!!! Its absolute perfection coming to this diner. I've had nothing better in Vegas California Texas Arizona or Georgia or Utah. Thus place is where they created the most simplest way to make delicious food. The home made jam is a must! The steak made me dream about it 2 days later!! But theeeeeeee best thing to eat when its available has to be the HUMMINGBIRD CAKE. My goodness its again perfection shaped like a cake. Its a hidden gem service is excellent its got a 60's vibe to it which I love decor is old school and I believe the owner greets you at the entrance and check's up on you from time to time. Longest review I've ever done and this place deserves it. I posted no pictures of this place because I haven't yet decided which one is the one that deserves that price cause everything I've had here is super delicious.

Awful. My Eggs were over cooked, but the Bell peppers were raw.. And there was no way my omelette was 3 Eggs, it was so small. My toast was burned and and swimming in butter, my bacon was burned and the hash browns were undercooked. There was 5 of us in my party and ALL of our food was awful.. How in the world is this place getting good reviews?? Our server was a space cadet as well, she spilled the same cup of orange juice twice.

I drive past at least 5 breakfast chain restaurants to get to Lou's diner. First of all, it's what prices SHOULD be. Affordable. The food is home-made so it's delicious. The staff is excellent and friendly. Make sure to try a slice of cake.

We stumbled upon this diner last weekend, and have been back for seconds already:) 

At 8 am on a Saturday, it was bustling with families and single people reading the paper. I love the homey feel here--it's decorated with knick knacks straight out of grandma's house. The staff are very friendly and they keep the coffee flowing. 

The menu is nothing fancy, but all the basics--omelettes, biscuits and gravy, chicken fried steak. There's a lunch menu, too, and a homemade pie or cake of the day, displayed on a cake stand under a handwritten sign. Everything I've tasted has been excellent, especially the home fries. I love that they have specials for seniors--I will definitely be bringing my parents here!
Great food with great service. Every time I visit Lou's I am greeted with a smile and I leave satisfied. Everything on the menu is good.
Came here on a trip and figured I'd stop in to grab some breakfast. This place makes me feel right at home... Good prices and great food!!

Prices are good, service is good, but the food adheres far too much to the "Americans like cheese and lots of cheese and maybe we should smother everything in some sort of sauce" philosophy. I should have known better than to order Huevos Rancheros.

Food was good service was great. Let me bring my dog as we were up for a vet appointment. Excellent customer service. Will go next time we're here. Oh and homemade raspberry jam great!! Thanks 5 stars!!

This place is a little ways from the Strip but worth the drive. Do you really want to pay $15.00+ for a half-cooked omelette? Anyway, you know that you are in a local spot when 9 out of 10 patrons are locals. Walking in, we were greeted warmly by a waitress. Not the "thank you for coming to our establishment" kind of greeting but more like "Hi hon! Just grab a seat and we'll get right with you!" with a big smile. The greetings from the other patrons were not so nice. It was more like "Oh crap! more of these damn tourists!" 

Our food was amazing. I know you really can't screw up breakfast foods but their food was fresh and tasty. The biscuit and gravy was excellent. The corn beef hash was delicious. They also offered a variety of items on their lunch menu, including fresh baked pies. 

The reason why we really loved the place was that the owner, Brian, stopped by to talk to us. Not just your usual "how's everything?" greeting but he actually stopped and I mean talked to us for a while. I even told us about his family and how they like to spend their vacations. Right is the middle of a busy morning. That's really cool and meant a lot to us. Every restaurant should be like this! It was so good we came back the next day.
This was our first time here . The environment is so cute and the food was so good ! The pancakes ARE HUGE ! But they are so delicious ! Would definitely recommend this Diner

Old school since 1969. These mom and pop places shine all the way through. We came here to have a good breakfast and this restaurant delivered. I ordered my favorite Vegas breakfast dish which is Steak & Eggs, hash browns, and sourdough toast. The friendly waitress offered us a Cinnamon Roll to start before we received our food, we said YES! After we devoured the roll we received our food. My dish was perfect just the way I like it and my girls loved their food also, they both are picky eaters. The owner came by our table to make sure everything was okay, we happily said yes. If you are in the mood for breakfast skip nasty Denny's or ihop and instead try a mom and pop place like this one, you won't be disappointed.

Tried this place as a suggestion from a friend and it was great! Had breakfast and everything was good. It was crowded so you may have a bit of a wait. Not a big place either. But be patient and enjoy all the memorabilia on the wall. You won't be disappointed.

I read some good reviews on this place and decided to give it a try . I was not disappointed ! My son and I really liked the Chicken Fried Steak . You could tell it was handmade with cube steak and not a frozen patty . The cinnamon roll was also homemade with good icing , not too sweat like cinnabon . They also have preserves that are made by the owner , and the raspberry is out of this world . I bought a small mason jar to take home . The biscuits were fluffy , grits cooked just right , and eggs cooked perfectly could have used another one . We will be coming back and looking forward to trying other things . You have to be careful driving here because you will easily pass it as I did , and had to drive back around the block . I recommend you come and the server was very nice .
Great place good food. Country combo rocked. Old Las Vegas feel. Will definitely go again.
A great breakfast place tucked away from your eyes. Awesome food with such sweet servers. We coincidentally found this place after egg and I was too crowded and I'm glad we did. Try their everything!
Breakfast was delicious got stake and eggs and the meat was soft and juicy...employees are very friendly and sweet will be visiting again
First time at Lou's. We've been driving by for years and stopped in. Great food and service. We had breakfast and will definitely be back to try lunch!
Great off the strip place for breakfast. If you like homemade salsa, ask for it. It has a nice kick, dependent on your tolerance.

This diner is very clean and open quite late. The service was attentive and friendly. 

Pros: portions are huge, food tastes great

Cons: price is steep for a diner but since the portions are huge you could split a dish. 

The menu is quite large and all the desserts look good. I will need to visit again to consider a 5th star.

So my son and I tried this place for the 1st time on the recommendation of a great friend. I so glad I asked her is she knew of a good place for breakfast. This place reminded me of a good old fashioned diner. The waitress was so friendly. Got my son some coffee and me some juice right away. I was so happy that they had skillets on the menu. Came out just how I like it. Scrambled well. Jeromy had a good old fashion eggs and sausage and toast. Which came out to his liking. One of the other best things was the jam. Fresh mixed fruit. Wish I could have taken some of that home with me. In closing try this place you'll be glad you did. It's not so pretty on the outside but the food was delicious. I will for sure be going back. Probably take the family.
Best diner in Las Vegas. We tried it for the first time and will def be returning. Great food and friendly service too. Thank you
Great home cooked diner fare! Chicken fried steak, Curtis Haystack, Brad's Burrito, all delicious. Friendly, prompt staff.

Great place,delicious food, service with a smile,and very friendly people. Renee was our server and made our 1st visit fun and enjoyable. Love the nostalgic decor! I had some type of breakfast stack with egg biscuit and gravy,and potato. Fabulous!
After breakfast step next door and get a haircut with Ray,tell him I sent you..great guy! I definitely will be back to Lou's!
Love this small quant diner, with great food and the owner/manager is awesome checked on is a couple times!

Omg what is there not to love. It's the perfect little mom & pop place that's north of the overpriced and overpacked strip & downtown. It's real home town food with good service and awesome prices. We were greeted immediately and noticed all the little knick knacks that lined the walls including an original newspaper from when Lennon was shot! The cinnamon rolls were to die for! Definitely a place I'd go to again... just need more help to speed up service. The waitress was amazing but busy!

I grew up going to this place. It's a good old family restaurant. The service is great and the food is good. It's nothing fancy, but you will enjoy the home town feel. This is what Vegas used to be. Don't be surprise if other guest actually say hi to you and everyone in the restaurant is friendly to each other.

Lou's is really that down at home diner. The hours are from 6am to 3pm. Each time we step into Lou's , there's always that warm fuzzy feeling, and you're always greeted with a smile.

One more thing I really Love about Lou's is the triple layer chocolate cake. Really moist and unforgettable !

Step back to diner days.   Surprisingly bright and clean diner in a hard to see from the street is really good. Nothing fancy but food that is made straight forward.  Skillet breakfast is what it  should be potato, sausage, some peppers, cheese and topped with a properly cooked eggs. Sharrie had the senior breakfast with great biscuit and gravy.  Good place to eat, will be back

First time visiting. Our server, Renee, was fantastic. I wanted the SOS on toast, but with chopped beef. She asked if they had any, and I got it just like my mom used to make. We will be definitely be back!

Lou's is a charming little diner near Decatur/Alta next to Walgreens. When I used to work at Western HS we would meet here every Friday morning at 6 am and did so for several years. 

Over the years I've tried the eggs, omelets, chicken fried steak, oatmeal, bagel and fruit combos, but the real stand-out is their skillet breakfast. They also offer grits in lieu of potatoes.

The other breakfasts are truly average, but the skillet is loaded with hash browns, your choice of meat, (your choice of anything else actually - onions, peppers etc) loaded with cheese and topped with eggs any style. 

Lou's probably rates 3* but I'm bumping it up one because it's the best skillet I've found thus far in Vegas (and also I see my priest in there occasionally - don't know why that influences me, but for some reason it does).

I used to come here for the SOS which was as good as I ever had. The last two times it was definitely "different" and tasteless. I asked the waitress about it and she immediately became very defensive exclaiming "the recipe has NEVER changed"! I beg to differ as I have been going there for at least 25 years, before it changed names. My brother was visiting from Texas and he also felt the same way about the SOS. He had eaten it earlier on two different occasions and went home bragging about it. No more! Too bad really!!

Comfort food at its finest. Reasonable prices. Great portions. My dad is picky and he found a breakfast entree made the way he usually orders. It was called Curtis' Stack. It was biscuits, hash browns, eggs, and meat smothered with gravy. He was a happy boy. Brian and his wife are very friendly and down to earth. This reminds me of home. My stomach belongs to Lou's!

Love this place!
Thanks for making us feel like part of the family!
We'll be back! Hugs for bringing smiles to our face and filling our tummy's with yummy food!
Great find off the strip with great prices. Loved the home made jam, that was a great touch!  Great place to stop if visiting LV.
I love this place patty is funny and amazing #favorite you can even meet the owners lol
We just moved to town and are looking for a new "regular" restaurant for breakfast and lunch. This might be it! Good food, reasonable prices, great service.
Food nice and hot. Dark meat nice and juicy. Mash potatoes really hot burnt my mouth first taste. Cashier good customer service and fast great up selling. Clean tables and chairs.

First few times this place exceeded our expectations and I gave five stars, but since my last review of Lou's we've been back three more times and been disappointed all three times.  Not sure what happened, whether it's chef or other issues but it's just not the same. Order was wrong twice, ordered hash and got home fries instead, and then this last time my tiny poached egg was hard boiled! Another time we waited an exceedingly long time for our order with others around us receiving their food even though they arrived later and ordered way after us. We questioned the whereabouts of our order and after about another 20 minutes were finally served. Not sure it's worth driving all the way here anymore.
La comida estuvo riquÃ­sima y con un excelente servicio. Los precios son bastante razonables

Was such a treat for us. Food was fantastic and perfect lots and lots of things to pick from off of the menu. You can come here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There is so much to pick from off the menu we totally enjoyed our meal.

At this place for the first time based on a neighbors recommendation . Very clean with reasonable prices. Also features several senior specials. Food is average but good with good service.
We will return in the future with friends.
Great lunch selections on menu which we will try upon our return
All in all a good experience at this little hidden place which I've passed a million times and never knew existed

We wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle by the strip so we took a chance with Lou's Diner. Drove out of our way to get here but it was worth it. When we pulled up we were a little skeptical, but this little hole-in-the wall diner really came through. Nice friendly people, owner came up to greet everyone and employees were extremly helpful. GREAT EXPERIENCE

delicious breakfast , nicest waitresses ever, young generation have to learn from those ladies how to be real and treat guests in right way ! home made potato reminded me of my childhood ! food! is so perfect on salt just the way I love! 
Thank you everyone for great morning breakfast and positive vibes!
dont forgot to put a pin at the World Map if you are from out of town! :)

It was my first time here. It is a mom and pop diner. It has kind folks and good food for a reasonable price. The inside reminds me of a diner you will find on a roadtrip on Route 66. I like it and will definitely be back.

Jams, "cinnamon roll" (it's not conventional), pie. The rest? Everything was off temp. Or burnt. Or microwaved (cold center). Much better coffee than expected. Friendly service. But don't believe the hype re: most of their fare inc. hot cakes.

Great breakfast food, their turkey sausage is good along with there house made jelly. The menu has a large array of breakfast dishes. This restaurant in never overly crowded, so you can always seat yourself. You food is out within 5 to 10 minutes. The waitresses are always very nice and polite.
Be careful or you'll drive right by it. Food was good, well-prepared, friendly service, personal touches.

Wow! This place was outstanding!! I am not a b fast person. This trip we ate at the egg and I and then Lou's. I pretty much ordered the exact same dish at both. Hands down, Lou's and really not even close! I also got a sweet roll to start and might be the best I've ever had! And my 10 year old loved her pancake. She said I had to put that in. And we are still here to leave this review which means they aren't rushing us to fill our seat with the next guest.

This place is reminds me of the old TV show Cheers.  From the time you walk in the door, you are treated like family.  The servers are friendly and often funny, and Brian does his best to greet every person or shake every hand in the house.
He makes some killer jam.  There are a couple of standard flavors and always a new or special flavor.(Today it was apple jam. I could take a dish and eat it with a spoon like applesauce)   There are breakfast, lunch, sandwich, and soup specials every day.  I've never had anything I didn't like. It's all fresh, real food that feels like it came from Mom's kitchen.

Wonderful service and great people.  Good classic diner food at good prices. Homemade jelly to die for.  Relaxing atmosphere is a nice change from the chain restaurants.  Lots of specials that sounded scrumptious-wish we lived here so we could try them all!  Thanks Brian for your great smile and friendly service!

When I pulled up to the restaurant, I thought my friend was crazy to suggest lunch there. I mean seriously, I was supposed to eat at Cheesecake Factory. WOW, was I wrong! 

The food is SPECTACULAR! We actually ate lunch twice just to try more things on the menu and took home 2 slices of their amazing homemade cake. The only thing I regret is that I didn't order the deep fried haddock too, but I will just have to go back. Lou's is a step back in time to when restaurants actually offered great quality,  great tasting food with personal service and a homemade touch.

Trying to get food before heading out. Of course I "yelped" this for a place. This was our first choice. It was packed when we arrived but we were great with a smile by a very nice gentleman (didn't get a name). So many menu options but we finally made a decision. I had breakfast chicken fried steak fried egg whites (special order), hash browns, toast, and coffee. Wow! Too much food for me. I was offered a choice of homemade jam yum! Everything was delicious. So, why a 3? Our waitress, Nancy, well, she wasn't very friendly. I could tell she was trying too hard to be nice to us. As I watched her interact with the other customers I could see the difference. When we got ready to leave or course I asked for s box and I asked if we could get some of that homemade jam to go (I had a lot of toast left) she said, "no. I can't give you any to take" and walked away. Really! So, we asked again. Same response. If Nancy would have been nicer I would have given a higher rating, as the food was delicious.

This is my first time here. I wanted a good breakfast that was actually cooked and not just thrown together. I found this place on Yelp and decided to take a very short trip off the strip. This place is truly the best breakfast I have had in all of my trips to Vegas. 
I had the Curtis which is a pleather of hash browns then two fluffy biscuits go on top of that. The gravy is poured on top and then two scrambled eggs make this the bomb! The sausage patties on the side are like icing on a cake. This place works hard on making sure you are satisfied and that the food is done right. 
And when you think you are done, they have a cinnamon roll that is worthy of being on a page by itself. They mix the cinnamon in into the flour to make it so that the cinnamon doesn't over power you like most when the put it on the outside of the cinnamon roll. The icing is so creamy and has just the right sweetness. 
I definitely will be back on my next visit.
Lous diner at Decatur and Alta has excellent food and the staff take excellent care of their customers 100 per cent Bodacious

My mom ordered the biscuits and gravy, took one bite and knew instantly it was horrible! I even took a bite and I couldn't eat them at all. The gravy was putrid!! We informed the waitress that they were horrible and asked for a menu. She did not ask if we wanted something else in exchange, and didn't offer to remove them from the ticket. So I ended up paying for nasty biscuits and gravy that I didn't even eat. Would not return!

Very yummy,  great prices and friendly staff 
Food comes out on the quick side

I had the corned beef hash with over easy eggs and grits
The hash was yummy, eggs perfectly runny. I think grits would be better with cheese- but I added pepper, salt, and hot sauce and was happy

My bf had chicken fried steak, over easy eggs, and hash browns 
The chicken friend stake came in a large serving, eggs perfectly runny - the did forget them at first but we're quick to remedy the situation-, the hash browns were good. I do like them a bit more cooked through but still good.

We shared a cinnamon bun.
The dough was on the moist side, almost a bit mushy inside. The icing was amazing.

We also had their straw berry jam
Yummy. Real pieces of strawberries

I'd come back

Everyone there is so friendly. Service was exceptional!  We came back for 3 days in a row for breakfast.  My daughter loved the home made jelly. We had bottomless coffee, ask for the vanilla creamer.  Did I mention friendly.

Best breakfast ever.Prices are good. Portions are large.Everything was homemade.Our waitress Party was wonderful.Funny and efficient.She even gave my partner a sample of green chili.The carrot cake looked amazing.I would go back anytime.Tourists take note.
Fun diner type restaraunt. Food delicious and plenty of it. Homemade jellys n deserts. Tried the belgian waffle, n yummm.  Nothing fancy but good food.

Went to try this place for the first time, right away when I walked in I felt very comfortable due to the old fashion home style setup as in all the decorations. The service in my opinion could have been better, was slow at filling my water for refills, didn't let us know that she put the check down while we were waiting thinking that we still needed the check, I don't like when the waitresses try to impress me so hard by the conversation, I just want refills and my food. The food on the other hand was pretty good,I ordered the tuna melt with fries and a dinner salad, the dinner salad was just basic, the fries were not really fully cooked in my eyes, but the tuna melt was out standing! Also the bill was not that high for the food. I would come back here but not as a favorite new place.
Just ate brunch here with my friend.  We enjoyed looking at all of the vintage antiques while eating my delicious meal.  I even took home a homemade  blueberry pie.

My favorite local breakfast spot. The owner and staff are very friendly and the food is awesome. Their seasonal pumpkin pancakes (winter) are the best! If you haven't tried Lou's you really need to. You won't regret it.
Truly an old school diner. The staff are extremely helpful and personable. The owner is fairly new but seems to really have to operations down pat. I look forward to dining again.
This place is the best!! Home cooked meals in an old diner with great service!!
Amazing!!!!!  Worth the 10 minute drive from the strip.  Family owned home made food.  Love the turkey Swiss green chili omelet!  Service was A+. We have are here 3 days in a row!!

Everything you'd expect in an authentic old school dinner. Open face sandwiches, Monte Cristo, lots of breakfast items and my favorite, chicken fried steak. Great waitress with plenty of personality. Everything tasted as you would expect serving authentic diner food. Real deal.

Lou's is a little "hole in the wall" gem that I came across about 2 years ago while searching and searching for an east coast diner type place here in the little old desert.

One of the reasons that I give Lou's 5 starts is because they have "old fashioned", no frills, down home eats .... Things like Creamed Chipped Beef which most people out here don't even know about.  

Everything at Lou's is made from scratch.  They are open limited hours - like 6am to 2pm and are closed on Sundays and maybe Mondays (I can't remember).  Lunch specials are about $6.99 and they include salad or soup - you really can't beat it.

I normally come here on the weekends for cream chipped beef - something my mom always made but for whatever reason - it's damn near impossible to find the proper dried beef out here. 

In addition to the creamed chipped beef - we've also ordered french toast, various sandwiches from tuna melts to clubs and I've also had their home made New England clam chowder and chicken n' dumplings.  You seriously CANNOT beat $7.99 for a big ole' bowl of chicken n' dumplings and a cup of clam chowder.  The claim chowder is seriously one of the best chowders that I've had in Vegas.
 
The owners are a very friendly husband and wife who are often seen sitting in their "office" (a booth in the back of the restaurant) and the staff is ALWAYS friendly.  The male half of the couple does all of the baking and he makes some GREAT pie as well as some moist as chocolate layer cake.
Drove here from the strip for breakfast and it was well worth it. Great food, prices and service. What more could you ask for? A great little authentic American diner experience check it out.

I have been here twice great experience both times!! I had the salmon with rice. I love how they put a great amount of butter on the bread  This will now be my must stop in Vegas . The parking is limit but don't forget the parking behind building there is also an entrance in the back.

Lou's Diner has been a Charleston Heights neighborhood staple for a few decades now. The diner's ability to stay around that long in a city filled with $4.99 breakfast buffets is a testament to the quality of their food. The diner is a quaint little place with a homey atmosphere. The skillet breakfast are among the best I've ever had with an ample amount of breakfast meats (something that most places skimp on) in all dishes. There are always a number of breakfast and lunch specials on the board which are always a good deal. There was a time a couple years ago where the service became a little spotty, but I'm happy to say the Lou's has resolved that issue. The service is now friendly and more importantly, quick. If you haven't tried Lou's it's worth checking out.

Breakfast was yummy! The ham steak was juicy. Eggs were cooked perfectly with cheddar cheese. The pancakes had a pretty good taste but a bit tough, I didn't finish them.. but hubby loved his corned beef hash and the home fries potatoes were cooked and seasoned very well .ww will be back for more !! Great service and quick with food service!

Best Diners restaurant I've ever visited. So hidden, family-friendly, and great service! A lot of historical memorabilia from John Lennon and John F. Kennedy's assassination, antique telephone. Oh, and if you become a regular, you can bring your very own coffee mug, hang it on the wall behind the counter area and use it each time you visit. So unique! Definitely coming back again!!

Went here for breakfast last week. The food was good nothing to fancy or over the top crazy here. It's a small joint so I wouldn't recommend going with a big party to this dinner maybe 5 or 6 people max. The prices are great, you get some good food for cheap which is a lot better than some of the place around town that charge more but the food is mediocre. In my opinion stay away from the potatoes that are cut up, I believe they call them hash fries, because they were most definitely under season and had a bland taste. Everything else was good I had the breakfast skillet with sausage and bacon, I will be getting it with hash browns next time. The pancakes where great my son was in love he ate all of his plus he had some of mine as well. The staff is friendly and always around when you need them, but not to the point where you can't enjoy your meal. Also take a look around while your there check out this place personality, you just might be amazed.

It is a seat yourself type of place so if you are going I would get there early. They close at 3 seeing as how they only serve breakfast and lunch, with breakfast being all day. Hope you enjoy a good meal here. I would recommend this place to someone who likes small dinners with corky decorations and is a chain restaurant.
Good food, better service. Great family environment. And they don't like the Cowboys!

My wife and I recently moved into the neighborhood and had noticed the sign behind the McDonald's/Walgreens in the corner.

Oh boy are we glad that we tried it! It feels like a small town diner from an era before. It's really quaint and the staff are all amazing. Patty was our waitress and did an incredible job checking in with us and refilling our coffee.

I got the special of the day- Strawberry Stuffed French Toast with a side of home fries, and my wife ordered the Pan San (pancakes with eggs, meat).

The pancakes were fluffy and soft (not rubbery or dense like Ihops), and the strawberry stuffed French toast was seriously delicious. I couldn't stop eating it. The sausage links served on the side were massive and delicious, the eggs were cooked to perfection.

This is definitely going to be our new regular breakfast spot!
Lous diner on Decatur and Alta in las vegas nevada has really good food and the staff take excellent care of their customers 100 per cent
I love lou's dinner.  Best food.  Not a great atmosphere but good food.

This place takes the cake in having the best ownership in town. Brian is so kind and was overly accommodating to the three little ones in our group. There was not a bit of food left on anyone's plate. It is simple and the way breakfast should be. I look forward to returning for well-priced good food in a space where I'm not afraid to bring my child.

Lou's decor is a visit back in time. Lots of memorabilia from the day, things you probably had in your home. On this day for breakfast our server was Patty. She was friendly and attentive. Coffee cups and water glasses were kept full. Lou's menu has many choices. Today I chose the veggie omelet with grits. The omelet was plentiful with a nice variety of vegetables. The grits were creamy and hot. Overall Lou's is a comfortable place for a tasty meal with great atmosphere. Don't pass on the triple chocolate cake even if you must take it home. One slice serves 2 people.

I wanted a great breakfast and that's exactly what I got at Lou's!!!! The food is great and the atmosphere is awesome!
Do I mention they have home made jam!!

I have not been to LOU'S for awhile ... but I came in today to have a late breakfast .... $8.99 Polish Sausage & Egg Special ... I had to send back the skinny hot dog disguised as Polish Kielbasa ... my home fires were not well done as asked ... my toast was forgotten ... nice waitress ... re-did my order this time with bacon ...  nice atmosphere ... my food?  ... no so nice ...  great homemade jams ... great big cakes! ....  in Las Vegas ... if you do not have great food & good value ...adios!
Love our little local diner. Awesome breakfast and lunch! I highly recommend their omelette and homemade jellies!
If I lived in Las Vegas I would be eating at Lou's every weekend! If you are visiting Las Vegas this is a must! Uber, Lyft or taxi yourself to Lou's.

You can't beat the atmosphere of Lou's. It's a flashback to a simpler time. Every visit you are greated with a smile and great service. I've never seen the bottom of my coffee cup and always leave feeling like that was going to be the only meal of the day. The chicken fried steak was huge and topped with some of the best gravy around. I'd put their pancakes up against anyone's in a "Battle for best breakfast." Located on the NE corner of Decatur/Alta, it is well worth the trip from anywhere. If you're looking for a good, hearty, stick to your ribs breakfast, you won't be disappointed. The staff is fast and friendly and doesn't mind if you want to substitute or have a special request. I would highly recommend the "Hay Stack" for first time guest. Our crew from work has kind of become regulars here. We are never dissatisfied and we keep coming back.

I had seen Lou's Diner one day while I was out running errands I stopped by but it was early evening and they were closed. I made a mental note to come back during business hours but I soon forgot and living in the NW we usually just go to Cracked Egg or Bagel Cafe when we go out for breakfast. The other day I mentioned Lou's to my wife and looked at their hours and we were lucky enough to have enough time to make it over. It was worth the wait. Hands down the best breakfast I've had in the valley. That was last Friday. This Friday we went to Lou's again. My wife had the fried egg sandwich again. She loves it especially with their homemade mixed berry jam.
I had the pancakes and egg breakfast last week. Best pancakes ever. Today I had the tuna melt and clam chowder. Amazing. Their desserts are also spectacular. We got them to go both times. I can't wait until next Friday to see what delicious meal I'll order.

Eclectic family style breakfast dinner experience. i enjoyed the proportions and duh the food was indeed like family. They even offer homemade jam with the toast.... another yum... now I did want some of the homemade dutch apple pie,but it was already gone.... Hello people its 10:30 am.... they coulda saved me some..... guess I will just have to come back....

We love Lou's! What a little hidden gem of a place...the food is great, like the comfort food you would eat at gramma's house. The decor-comfortable vintage homey feel! The owner is frequently there to make sure your lunch experience was the best, they really care about their customers! I only have one complaint- I wish Lou's was open longer  They close at 3 everyday so plan accordingly.

The best priced, old school, real diner in Las Vegas.  This place is a family friendly throw back to a time where servers and cooks cared about the food they served, the people they served and a time where breakfast didn't break the bank.

I love it at Lou's and it's always my goal to eat breakfast here at least twice a week.  Try Patty's homemade cinnamon rolls or the from scratch chicken soup, you won't be disappointed.

We go to Lou's about twice a month. The food has all of the basics and they are satisfying. Order the country fried steak with gravy. The service is great and the atmosphere is nostalgic with old pieces of items you might remember seeing in your grandparents house. ..very vintage and retro. Go ahead and try it.

I ordered here for a co workers birthday, so we had 5 orders. When I got to the restaurant to pick up the orders no one seemed to know that they are on Yelp until a woman said oh yeah the big order and seemed to be bothered by it. She than told me that she just wrote the order up and it will be sometime, I asked her OK about how long she walked over to the cooks came back and said yeah so that will take sometime, I had to then guess as to how long the wait would be and said so 15 mins and she said no it shouldn't be that long, I told her that the yelp app said that it would be ready by 110pm,. she then seemed really bothered and asked me, now why would it say something like that, I told her I didnt know but I can show her the confirmation, she walked away, I then took a seat anywhere because I wasn't offered to sit as I wait for my order i put in over 20mins ago and the yelp app said that it would be ready at 110pm. I sat there for 5 mins when she brought my food to me, I thanked her a few times and she never responded to me. I get back to my office and realized that one of our orders was missing and the turkey sandwich did not have Bacon on it like described in the menu on yelp so called the restaurant to notify them of the error and they said the order that was missing was not on the order, I then said it was and they said wait yep it is and to come and it will be ready in 2 mins, I went over and got the order and they gave me the bacon for the sandwich, then the lady told me that she gave us the turkey sandwich not the turkey club, and expanded to me what the club was and why the bacon was not on it. I will never order from here again which it isn't because the food was bad the food was actually pretty good, it was the way the waitress made me feel and wanted to argue her point to me instead of stepping back to listen to me and my concerns, she wanted to argue the missing meal and the sandwich why it didnt have the bacon. The food is good the service is not.

Thank you,
Amanda

Best place for breakfast hands down 
You have to try the homemade jams
Friendly service fun environment

The magic is back what left for awhile under previous owners is back under new owner Brian and family including the food and the fantastic sevrvice ! All the specials are home made , nothing frozen ! Best diner in town 2-3 times a week at least will b here j

After a friend recommended Lou 's,  I had to try it. So here it is - The Good - The Bad - and,  The Ugly.
The Good.  Nice atmosphere. A throwback to years long gone. The waitresses are helpful,  and few are actually walking talking stereotypes of a stereotypical 50 's and 60's era diner. Opinionated older women that roll their eyes a lot when commenting on current events. Lot's of "color commentary ". I thought I'd stepped back in time,  I choose to put this in the "good " category,  but someone else might not dig it. The food portions are MASSIVE. Not necessarily flavorful - but humongous. The prices are more than fair,  the cost of a meal is *cheap *.
The Bad. AND The Ugly.  I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak. With O 'Brien potatoes,  scrambled eggs, and toast. With gravy.  The gravy was all but tasteless white goo. Pretty generic. Thank God for the salt & pepper. The chicken fried steak 's breading was like kevlar. The steak itself was done in most parts - very pink in other parts. All in All,  I would not go back. 
I wanted to like this place,  but I was disappointed.  The food was just not well prepared.

Great chow, great waitress and an attentive owner add up to what appears to be 50 years of great service.  Established in 1969, this place is tops!
Recommend to anyone and everyone.  Just topped Dupars and that is a feat all in itself.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere!  Very friendly!  The food was delicious and the coffee was mmmmm-good!  Prices are reasonable!  You've got to try Lou's Diner!  Thanks again Lou's Diner team, you all have something really good going here!  Thank you
Delicious home style breakfast that is adorable, fast, and with the best service that anyone could ask for.

I am a huge proponent of shopping locally, and this includes my quests for good food in hidden away places.  This is why stumbling across (OK stumbling isn't quite right, Google Maps helped and I won't eat breakfast on the strip) this gem of a greasy spoon.  I say hidden because it is off Decatur snuggled in behind a Taco Bell.

When I first walked in the door I was warmly greeted and took a seat at the counter, which is my favorite spot when dining alone.  My waitress' name was Renee who greeted me with hot coffee and a menu and suggested that I make sure to read the history of the joint on the back of the menu; which kicked off my sense of nostalgia because I love stuff like that.

I ordered my staple of eggs over easy, hash browns with white toast and the ham steak.  my order came out perfect (so many places overcook the eggs) and it was delicious.  In fact there was more food than I knew what to do with and this from a guy who is 6' 3" and clocking in at 218 lbs.

If I had any room left, I would have had a slice of that pink double layer cake that was so high that it took two people to slice a piece and juggle it in one piece onto a plate for a customer.  I am still thinking about that cake 24 hours later.

So back to the history of the joint.  Lou's diner has changed hands a couple of times over the many decades and has remained in some way or fashion in the family of the original owners.  Until this last December.  This is when a new couple (I am so sorry I totally forgot their names, but they were so nice) just starting out their lives together bought the joint.

When a place I like changes hands, it usually suffers an identity crisis as the new owners try to put their own stamp on it and make it better.  THANKFULLY, this couple understand what Lou's is and who their customers are....  And have kept it the way it should be.

That hidden away gem, that serves great food in a setting that I will be visiting again and again when I come back into town.

Great service. This place has a Simple and cozy ambiance which is why I guess alot of locals go to there to eat .Friendly staff and reasonable prices for great food! Will come back next time we visit Vegas!!!!!!! Highly recommended!

My husband & I have passed this spot many times & finally after reading other excellent YELP reviews we decided to give it a try!
I'm so so glad we did because we both loved everything about Lou's Diner....
Let me start off by saying when we first walked in we were immediately greeted as a pregnant woman my body temperature always fluctuate's I was happy it was nice & cool inside they're not stingy with there Ac like other places, we got to seat ourselves & were immediately served with menus & our beverages. 
I like the waitresses because they're all welcoming & knowlegeable about the menu.
The food was EXCELLENT the prices were decent for the amount of food you get.
They make there own jelly & ask you what kind you want....it's so yummy you must try!
The owner Brian makes it a point to say hello & what I like about him is he actually walked to all the tables to see & make sure everyone was happy.....you rarely see that now at days, I felt very comfortable that he took the time to come up to my husband & I talk to us & asked us about our honest opinions about the food & service he's pretty awesome even shaking my husband's hand before we left.
I can't wait to go back to try all the other yummy foods on the menu. 
If you're in or around the Las Vegas area I would defenietly recommend stopping by Lou's Diner
Great local breakfast place! Love to come here anytime we can, service is always great and the food is always very fresh. I recommend this place to everyone!

First time in this gem of a local diner. Had a wonderful experience, service was excellent and staff very friendly and appreciative. Food was exactly what you'd expect from an old school diner. The corn beef hash is as good as what you'd find in the South. Their home made preserves are phenomenal. We ordered one pancake to see what they can do on the griddle - their batter needs a little work compared to other local pancake houses. Everything else was nothing short of perfect. Will make this our regular breakfast place.

The worst.  Rude rude rude.  Watched 3 tables put thier order in while we sat arriving 15 minutes before the other tables.  All the old sea hag servers dont even help,  just look at us andlet us sit.    Our server extremely frazzled and very obviously pissed we sat in her station.   DONT GO HERE!  NOT by first bad experience but for n sure my last.  Where are the owners????? No music! Old ex tweeker server,  yuck.

Despite living here since the 80s... We missed this Gem.  Great food, Very nice staff and owner.  Its an old diner, full of fun decorations.  And the homemade jelly is worth getting toast.  Love the real homefries, and long time home favorites, cream chipped beef. We'll be back.

It's Like going to grandmas! Home style everything. People are super friendly and service is excellent. We had breakfast- amazing. Don't let outside keep you from going inside. Please check it out! Locals favorite.

Love this place! If you want simple old fashion good breakfast this is the place to be! Food is reasonable and food is delicious!!! Recommend the homemade jam all of their flavors. I order curtis haystack when im here. The staff is super nice and treat you like family!

YELP helped me find this place and am I glad it did. I was welcomed immediately and made to feel like an old time friend.  I'm picky about coffee and like French vanilla creamer.  When I saw there was none.  I resigned myself to no coffee when my waiter gave me some of his private stash.  Thanks Bryan.  Went there twice for breakfast.  My toast came with 3 homemade jams, each better than the next.  The haystack was recommended and I'm so glad I listened; potatoes, biscuits, sausage gravy, eggs and bacon on the side.  Tastes a lot better than it sounds. I would definitely go back when in town.

Great homemade food. Great prices. We had chicken fried steak, eggs Benedict, French toast, and homefries. All were cooked perfectly and would recommend you try all. Patty, our server, was a great attentive hostess even though the House was full.

My husband and I bumped into this hidden gem while driving one day. This diner is a classic diner and even has classic and historical decor from the 60's and 70's. The food was excellent and waitresses were very attentive. We will definitely be back.

An old style diner in Las Vegas. Lou's has been around for years and it is a nice place for breakfast and lunch. I work down the street, so it is convenient. It doesn't look like much on the outside, but they have certainly had fun decorating the inside.

The place is clean and the staff is helpful. Parking is usually easy. Fridays are great because their special is chicken and dumplings. ;)

I found this place on yelp while I was waiting at local dealership to repair my vehicle. I must say I think I got the best service I've ever had ,by Patty. Food was great and plentiful for a good price. They also make homemade cakes and pastries.

Visited on 10/14/17.  About 9 am.  Busy but no wait.  Two of us and a child.  We loved the food the service, and the owner, Brian.  The bacon was the best my lady has ever had at a restaurant.  The chocolate chip pancakes were superb according to the 8 year old :).  The owner gave the kid a puzzle to solve.  It kept him busy throughout the meal, yeah!  After he solved it, Brian gave him a treat.  He thought it was the greatest time he'd ever had at a restaurant.  So....the food was tasty, the service was exceptional, and the experience was wonderful.  The restaurant was very clean as well as the restrooms.  We'll definitely be back.

A very cute Mom & Pops diner. Reasonable prices. About 15 minutes drive from the Strip. They make their own jelly, it is to die for! Delicious! Courteous staff, ample parking, good food. What else do you need? :)
Great alternative to other dining options in the Vegas area.  Down to earth, unpretentious, good food.  Recommend for all ages... Had the skillet, eggs, potatoes, onions, hamburger, pik attached.
Me and my son have been going there for breakfast every Sunday for the last 8 years it is a wonderful place to eat very reasonable and the employees are as friendly as they get
Good enough... a dive diner, with inexpensive, pretty decent food and service.  It's been around for quite a while, so that says something as well.
Been coming here over a year and its still great quality food and big portions. That country gravy is soooooo good.

This place has amazing food end even better service. It feels like a perfect family dinner. We were here for 3 days of EDC and we are here 2 of the 3 days because we loved it so much. Get the house strawberry jelly too. All super good
I've only been here for a few minutes and I already feel like I'm at home. I think I found one of my new favorite breakfast places.

The service was ok. Food was bland. I've had several items, all were average. The huevos rancheros were a joke. More of a regular customer type of place, for people who don't want to go find good food.
A wonderful, friendly place with great food.  Highly recommend!  It was an accidental find but had the best breakfast during our stay in Las Vegas.
What a great place, staff, and food.  One the best secret places in Las Vegas.  The dinner has a cool history.  The owner always greats his customers and adds a personal touch.

Super good, super friendly. Gteat atmosphere. 
Reasonably priced. 
Try Julie's omelette!!
