This is a place that could be straight from Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  I was meeting friends for breakfast this morning but it fell through and I didn't get the memo.  After sending a text and finding out we weren't meeting, I searched the Yelp app for breakfasts restaurants and this was one of them that came up.  Off I was.

I was going south on Decatur and drove right on by when I noticed the blue symbol on my map was going away from Lou's.  I made a u-turn on a side street and started north on Decatur and there it was, tucked in a small strip mall removed some from Decatur and not having much curb notice.

When I went in, the first thing I noticed was the large amount of bric-a-brac in the restaurant most of it related to kitchens both commercial and home.  One thing that caught my eye was a box from my first food processor, a Veg-O-Matic.  It made me smile because I realized how old it was and therefore me.

My server, Patty, was to my table almost before I sat down (the sign says to seat yourself) and she was back quickly with coffee, a glass of ice water, and a menu.  After looking at the menu for awhile and checking the specials board, I ordered their chili and cheese omelette.  I had my choice of a couple of kinds of potatoes but I went with grits.  I also ordered rye toast.

Within a short time, my breakfast was delivered.  Everything was very good.  Patty asked if I wanted any hot sauce other than the Tabasco that was on the table and I asked for Cholula.  There was a nice container of butter with the grits and I let it melt and mixed it around with the grits.

Service was excellent!  Patty was back often to refill my coffee and it was a pleasant breakfast.  Since I was wearing a Syracuse t-shirt so close to the freeway, Patty assumed I was from out of town and she asked where I was from.  When I said Las Vegas, she asked how I found Lou's.  When I said, "Yelp," she asked, "What's Yelp!"  I explained briefly and shower her the app and she got the idea.  She was interested to know I'd be rating Lou's before the day was done.  

One last thing--there's a cardboard sign hanging on strings that says "Triple Chocolate Cake" and it has three arrows pointing to a cake holder on the counter.  I couldn't resist.  I bought a piece to bring home and have for dessert tonight.  I'm sure it will be just as good as breakfast!  This is a good breakfast spot.  The hiking group may rue their snubbing of me!

Addendum:  The chocolate cake was excellent!
Homemade jam was great! Yummy steak and eggs. Amazing service. We'll definitely be back

My grandfather ate here when I was a kid so it is crazy to step through the doors and back in time. It definitely has an ol' timey feel. I don't think the decor has changed since grandpa was a regular. The owners run the place from a booth by the kitchen, bringing a whole new meaning to hands-on ownership. 

The food is really good and there are many regulars (mostly seniors) who come to enjoy the home cooking.

The staff is hard-working and super friendly. Definitely worth a visit!

Our Old Dawgzs Veterans Group has been meeting here Tuesdays for lunch @1230 hrs last week and this week, the new owners Brian & Julie make us feel very welcome. Patty & Linda were our waitresses and everything we ate on the menu was great especially the Haddock fish dinner, fried chicken dinner & open face Turkey sandwich were repeats after each week, the homemade chicken soup was great also. Desserts are homemade and to die for. We as a group are going again next Tuesday because the prices are very reasonable and the customers seem very satisfied and are regulars to.
Gerald D Paul

My new favorite breakfast spot! 
The staff is so friendly and the biscuits are so fresh!
Not to mention the Awesome music they play. Cant wait to come back tomorrow.  



Back again, and just started to explore the lunch specials. BOMB!!!!!

I found Lou's Diner by accident.  I was in their parking lot to answer an e-mail, starving, and noticed their sign.  I pulled up my Yelp app, read a few of my Yelp friend's reviews, and made up my mind that I'm having eggs for lunch.  I walked in and it wasn't busy at all.  I sat myself and was a little concerned that the service would take a while since no one noticed me walking in.  Within 10 minutes, one of the waitresses attended to me and gave me a menu.  Their menu is mainly a traditional American breakfast (i.e. omelets, sandwiches, burgers, soups, etc.).  I kept my meal simple and had their 3 egg cheese omelet, 4 slices of bacon, well done extra crispy hash browns, and some toast.  This breakfast combo was very affordable at only $8.  I also added a cup of their homemade chili, which ended up being the highlight of my entire meal.  The chili has a bit of a kick, hearty, and had enough meat to satisfy my protein needs.  A cup of their chili is good enough to make me a repeat customer. If I had one gripe, it's the cheese in their omelets.  I prefer shredded cheese in my omelets, not sliced cheese. Lou's Diner was able to add shredded cheese to my chili.  Why couldn't they do this for their omelets? In the future, I'll request it.  It never hurts to ask, right?

This diner has been around a very long time.  It's nice to see businesses from the 60's still thriving.  It's also obvious that Lou's has its share of regulars.  The service was great and the price per dish is better than most.  I'm sure that I will be returning soon, especially if I'm craving their chili.

My boyfriend and I came in to eat. The food is absolutely delicious,  and they have great selections on their menus.   The service was even better. The staff was amazing.  The restaurant is very clean.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family! Can't wait to go back.

Lou's is the ultimate diner experience.  Food is great! The staff is wonderful, friendly and fun!  I live on the opposite end of town and go there whenever I'm within 10-15 minutes.  You know you are in a great diner when the toast isn't cardboard, the eggs are perfectly cooked and every time a different dish goes by you wish you'd gotten that.  The chocolate cake will make you a chocoholic.

Ate here for the first time yesterday. Took a little bit to get greeted once we sat ourselves but they were busy so still 5 stars. Their grits were the best I've had in Vegas and the rest of our food was good, too

We absolutely loved this restaurant!  My wife and I had lunch there for the very first time today.  The reuben had corned beef that was very tender and delicious.  The onion rings were cooked to perfection and very tasty!  The chili,  potato salad and the SOS were awesome!  The owner introduced himself to us, checked back to make sure we were enjoying our food, is a very kind soul.  The waitress was terrific and warm with a good sense of humor.  We left there with full stomachs and hearts!

So... We came to Lou's a while back because the folks at our fav antique mall recommended it.  Lou was still running it then.  Today, we visited again; it was packed with happy people!!  A very nice young man named Brian stopped at our table to ask if our food was ok; conversation led to us finding he was the new owner.  He informed us the only changes he made were to use social media to advertise and the addition of wifi-- he doesn't plan to change anything else.  Verdict:  Lou's is still (and will continue to be) a family-run, old fashioned family diner with excellent food and a neighborly vibe.  Breakfast is the real deal here... Delicious, and large enough you'll probably skip lunch.  Good quality food, nice wait-staff, and YOU feel like family when you are there.

My first time here everyone was very nice got greeted immediately seated right away liked the decor I ordered huevos rancheros sauce was very good although it wasn't how I pictured my food to come out it was still good food came out quick and hot definitely wouldn't mind returning again whenever in the area do accept card cute little spot did get busy after we arrived so it is a place to give a try
Brian, owns the dinner and has dedicated employees, he's there to great you, serves you and even bus the tables when needed. Food is excellent.  Vegas' hidden jewel

I haven't been in a diner with a counter since I was a little girl...until today. I dropped into Lou's for lunch and I felt like I had gone back in time to the very early 60's. The dÃ©cor is like a cross between Mayberry and Happy Days so you immediately feel at home. The menu is quite large and filled with comfort food.

As soon as I sat down, a waitress was at the table with a menu greeting me. I ordered the patty melt which is my comfort food and it was so good. The patty, the onions, a lot of melty gooey cheese and the bread was perfectly toasted but not greasy. 

As I was eating, I looked around the diner and listened to the waitresses greet people as they came in. Obviously, a lot of the patrons are regulars and I can see why.

The diner is clean, the waitresses friendly, the food is good and priced fairly. Will I be back, you betcha!
If you are looking for quality food, excellent service at reasonable prices then Lou's Diner is the place to go.  With out a doubt the best breakfast in town.

If you're looking for fine dining, Lou's Diner isn't it. But, if you're looking for comfort food in a fun, cozy environment with a friendly and fast staff, Lou's is definitely the place. 

A friend and I stopped in here for lunch one day and had the meatloaf special. Comfort food at its finest. Feels like the cafe my dad and I visited when I was growing up. I'll definitely stop in again the next time I'm in town.

Do you ever wonder if that Diner from the past exists, the ones where your waitress is more interested in how everyone in your party is doing rather than simply being a go between from the cook to your table?  That establishment still exists, it called Lou's Diner.

Our party of four tried Lou's Diner by chance as we initially drove by our first choice only to be greatly disappointed in the wait (of course I re-checked Yelp for our alternative) and I'm really glad we did.  Everyone loved Lou's.  Quality of food, speed, attentiveness, and of course . . . the great prices!  We left beyond full and making sure our waitress knew that we would be back (with more of our family too)!

Good coffee, pancakes, and breakfast burritos just to name a few.  Can't wait to get back there and try something else (or get those pancakes again)!

We came here on a whim, as it's close to the hospital. It's tucked back into a little shopping center, almost hidden from the road. As we got out of our vehicle, I could smell wonderful food cooking smells. Inside we got one of the last tables, which is a sure sign of a good restaurant. But this restaurant exceeded all of our expectations! Not only was the service beyond excellent but conversations with one of the owners was memorable, as he learned what we liked and pointed out a possible shopping gold mine. The real gold mine, we found was the food. Everything cooked to delicious perfection! Our teen, who was crappy, surly, and "not hungry", ate an entire Brad's Burrito!  The best part of all, is that the owners "office" is a corner booth, and they walk around, and visit with the clientele.

We went there for breakfast Sunday morning. Great service good food , reasonable prices. Our server was so nice. That was a 4 star experience.

Went back today for late lunch around 2 ( they close at 3) to try their catfish. $799 menu states comes with your choice of potatoes and veggies.  Server was in a hurry, no customers just in a hurry to get out as she stated several times. Did not ask for our choices ans hurried off. Came back with plates with 2  small catfish fillets thickly breaded, MASHED potatoes covered in beef gravy, even on the fish! Who serves mashed potatoes and beef gravy with fish? We are vegetarians, don't eat any meat other than fish. A little bowl of canned veg all and a stale roll.
WOW, then when we asked for another plate to get the fish off the plate with the gravy she brought the plate and picked up our fish with her bare hands! Owner sat 2 booths away, oblivious. Disappointed !

So limit you visits to breakfast, we will if we return.

Amazing food!! just like you cooked it yourself of course of you're a good cook that is.  The jam is fresh and made there. The biscuits are fluffy and tasty. The salad was fresh, ranch dressing was not from a bottle... if I could give this place 100 stars I would!!

We finally tried this diner who was recommended to us and omg! 
We tried their breakfast i had the pan san: 2 huge pancakes, 2 eggs and your choice of meat.
My husband had the classic bacon and eggs.
Those pancakes were amazing! And so big i could barely finish half. All for only $14! A steal in Vegas. Great atmosphere and friendly stuff! We can't wait to go back to try the lunch options !

Came here for bfast on recommendation and because of good reviews. Wanted the SOS on the menu, but was told they didn't have any. Huh? Ok. Had the standard bacon and eggs instead. Coffee was marginal. Maybe should try different brand. Liked that you can have grits instead of being force fed potatoes like every other diner. Could have been a larger portion of grits though. Toast was cheapest imaginable bread. Meh. Bacon was tasty but a little overdone. Eggs were normal. Prices were a little better than average. Food was up quick enough. Wait staff was friendly, but a little slow on the ball. Looks like their lunch and dinner menu might be ok. I'll try it again, but it doesn't seem to be a place you'd go out of your way for, pretty much average on all accounts.

Best place hands down! Me and my friends thoroughly enjoyed our meals we even came back the morning we were leaving town. Patty was wonderful and made sure everything was taken care of. Grab a Curtis' Haystack if your looking for something delicious.

I love old diners, so this is right in my wheel house. There's a fun story about the origin of this restaurant, check the back of the menu.

Great service, our waitress was friendly in that small-town kind of way. Coffee was always topped off and she was attentive. I had the hay stack, which came out a little different than I expected, but I would not shy away from it. We were here at breakfast, and I'd definitely come back to sample some more of the menu.
Great and attentive staff. Renee is a great waitress and Brian was very attentive. The eggs benny was yummy
Excellent service, big portions, not expensive, biscuits are homemade. I ate the breakfast and will be back before heading home!!!

Five star country breakfast. Delicious sausage well made gravy perfectly poached egg. Homemade hash browns yummy good and the price is just right. A funky little local dig not to be missed. Everything including the coffee exceeded expectations. About 10 minutes from the strip it's well worth the ride. Lou's Diner is a little country in rough. See you next trip Brian and staff!

This diner should be featured on the food network! Incredibly cute decor with such a homey feel as soon as you walk in. Linda, our waitress, was lovely and efficient. You can tell this is the type of place where the locals go regularly because they can't get enough of the tasty food and friendly service. Breakfast and Lunch is served all day! I would choose Lou's Diner over any chain around.

Before leaving Vegas we stopped in at lou's and I cannot recommend this place enough! Patty is the best damn waitress this town has ever seen and this is after waking up at 2 am to make home made cinnamon rolls that melt in your mouth! Food was great, prices are even better. Definitely plan on returning for our next trip to the strip!

Had the Monte Cristo! Omg with the Mixed Berry Jelly was AMAZING !!! Service was great, the staff was so friendly. You definitely feel a family vibe in Lou's Diner! I would so recommend this place to anyone!

Service Great,  Coffee Good, Eggs cooked to perfection, sausage patty awesome, friendly to tourists.  We really enjoyed our breakfast here after 2 days on the strip and wanted to get out of the craziness.   Yelp comes thru again.  Local group of car guys eating breakfast here on Wed morning.  The car guys usually know where to go for good food and service.  The new owners are carrying on the tradition of Lou's Diner.  Give it a try.

Service was nice, but chaotic. Pancakes were good, cinnamon roll was very good.  Monte Crusto was beyond greasy, fries nothing special,  apple pie mediocre.  I had high hopes for this diner, I wish it had been better.

Execellent service very friendly and polite I will go and eat there again when Im in my town.  So we decided to eat here cause of all the good reviews .  I don't regret eating the delicious country fried steak and sunny side eggs. The country fried steak was homemade it wasn't a frozen steak . Also if you want to eat some delicious pancakes well made with scramble eggs cause that's what my wife recommends.

I shared the Waffle San. Omg it was delicious. The waffle was hot and stayed warm until we ate the entire thing. The bacon was thick cut and had a wonderful taste. I will definitely be back. The owner Brian let me know they make their own jams so I'll be getting toast next time. The coffee is also farmer boys, another of my favorites.

great food great service great prices

the people were so nice during our stay in vegas & we just loved the food!

the environment felt great, seating was great, & the food was DELICIOUS 

during our stay for EDC, we decided to go twice because we loved it that much!

go visit it while you stay in vegas!!
What a cute diner! It's been here over 60 years. The service is excellent, and the breakfasts are traditional and yummy. This is going to be our new brunch place for sure.

With all the chains and over-priced restaurants in this town it was great to find an old-fashioned diner that serves standard American food at a fair price.  I tried them for the first time today and liked it.  I had that old diner stand by meatloaf.  All the food was hot and tasted good.  Great, old fashioned waitresses and decor that obviously hasn't changed in years made this a trip back in time.  My biggest fear is that with all the good Yelp reviews the millennial tourists will seek this place out for it's "irony" and "kitchiness."   You won't find any gluton free tofu and kale salads here hipsters.

I just wish this place was closer to my home.
This is A Fantastic Place...the portion of food omg u will have a take home and the ppl here are the.best..Dorreen is the BEST waitress ever....

I had been looking for a decent, and rare, Monte Cristo sandwich since arriving in LV.  It took me a couple of years to follow up on reports it existed at Lou's Diner before finally getting there today to check for myself.  Happily, I discovered it does indeed exist there!  The sandwich was nicely stuffed with ingredients, fried just so, came with the necessary raspberry jam, and tasted great!  My french fries were nothing special but good, and I'm told the coleslaw was good. Wait service was excellent.  We'll be back to check other options at Lou's as well as to revisit their Monte Cristo.

The place was packed when we arrived..we were welcomed and seated quickly..the waitress Linda was great..as busy as she was she was able to keep up and kept my coffee cup full!! The food was delishes..waffles and pancakes were great!!

Great little dinner that my husband and I were so thankful to find. Perfect little what reminds us of a small (mom and papa family restaurant) dinner with great tasting food and a very friendly staff. No wait, clean table, small, quite, great prices, close to the strip by not mixed in with all the craziness the strip has. Perfect place & best believe we will be back during our next visit.

Lou's has been in this location for as long as I can remember, however I never gave it a second look as it looks like a hole in the wall. My husband heard that ownership had changed, so he and his buddy went for lunch. OMG, he just wouldn't stop raving about how good the food was.... So, I had him take me for breakfast! Don't tell him, but he was right!! The waitresses are "classics", there's old photos of Las Vegas and kitschy trinkets all over the walls; it's a homey atmosphere. The owners regularly roam the dining area connecting with their customers. Lou's offers both breakfast and lunch during the limited daily hours. They have daily specials, homemade preserves and delicious homemade desserts. The portions are good for the price and the food is delicious! I highly recommend a visit to this Las Vegas classic.
Staff was excellent. The prices were great. If you're on a budget. Slip off the strip to this little hide away. For some good food and coffee. The pie was DA BOMB according to the Mrs.
Seated immediately, friendly staff, great service, food was hot and tasty, very nice traditional old school vibe, definitely would go back

Antiques galore with great hospitality everything you'ld expect from an old school diner and more!   The staff here is extremely friendly and make sure you are well taken care of during your visit.  

Seems like the majority of costumers here are working class mixed with retirees and definitely regulars to this establishment.  All the decor takes you back to a time definitely not forgetten here from the 1950's telephone to the early 80's Polaroid camera the window booths have vintage conversation starters galore.

The food is delicious and appropriately prices on my first visit I had Curtis' Haystack ( biscuits and gravy topped with hashbrowns eggs and bacon) and it was a full meal for sure so being your best appetite for that one 4.25/5 

Today I had the French Toast Special and the French Toast was prepared perfectly a nice buttery flavor and disappeared quickly. 2 eggs over medium and bacon completed the meal. 4.5/5.

So if you are looking for a nice relaxing breakfast /lunch spot with great service and delicious food look no further than Lou's Diner the Diner that time forgot.

We always drive by this diner and I've always been curious if it will be that gem I'm looking for. This has definitely been around long enough, 40 years and probably some of the old folks that are a majority of their patrons, have been regulars since this diners heyday. 

When you walk in, it feels dated in that way your grandparents would be. Lots of knick knacks on the walls and photos. The food is no frills type American diner fare, and cheap with pretty much everything under $10. My one thing is that the menu isn't really descriptive and while you wouldn't need a explanation for a tuna melt some things I would like to know. I could ask the waitress, but there was only one and she was running around so I felt I may be wasting her time. 

I went with a chicken fried steak since lately I've been in a mood for it. It was decent as far as they go. I can see why people like theirs here, but it's not my favorite in town. 

The BF got chicken and dumplings that was on the specials board. It comes with soup or salad and he got the clam chowder. The clam chowder was standard and decent. The chicken and dumplings was homemade and plentiful, dumplings really fluffy. I wish it had a bit of veggies in it, but otherwise it was good. 

It was solid, but nothing wow-ing really. 

I heard they may have homemade pastries pie here, but apparently they don't anymore really do that. Ah, boo. 

It's a A-OK diner, but it didn't click that perfect homey feel for me.
Service was phenomenal!! Quick in and out typical diner food but done well.

Obviously this is a good place for breakfast - everyone's reviews just Rave.  I tried it for lunch and was disappointed - no doubt if I were eating comfort food (and dessert) I would've been much happier. Unfortunately I was dieting.
I will come back someday for breakfast, and no doubt will write a five star review.

Lou's diner is a Las Vegas institution. The place is old school and friendly great food and the staff is over the top nice. The owners are down to earth people who love the diner and it's patrons. If your a local you know about Lou's  but if your a visitor definitely put this place on your list.
Love this place, great food, huge portions, great price, just like dinners where I grew up

This is just a classic old-school diner serving old-school comfort food.  I do believe Lou himself greeted us and brought our menus.  The place was IMMACULATE.  Walls covered in trinkets, pictures and knick-knacks and not a spec of dust...My house isn't as clean as this restaurant.  Service was more than adequate, about what you'd expect from a place that could've been pulled right from a 70's sitcom.  Lots of colorful characters enjoying their Sunday lunches, old regulars being sassed by the staff.

Why not 5 stars?  Well, our side salads were drenched in watery ranch dressing causing them to be more of a very odd cold soup of iceberg, tomatoes, cucumbers and yes...beet slices (?!).  Not inedible by any means, and maybe the institutional ranch dressing mix (this is NOT a slight...I actually love institutional ranch) was running low.  But unusual.  I had the New York Strip steak sandwich, which was functionally a slab of meat on two pieces of toast.

However, it was a FANTASTICALLY prepared slab of meat.  Perfectly cooked medium rare, perfectly seasoned.  Tender, juicy...honestly the best steak I've had in years.  It was so good, I didn't care about the ranch soup or the plain toast.  The steak made it all.  Fantastic job guys.

This place is just simple.  Home-town, friendly staff... adorably decorated for the holidays.  You'll feel like grandma's house.  Food will also help you feel like you're there.  Simple, but good.  Coffee kept coming, which if often a sore spot for me, so that was great.

I was in the food industry many years so trust me on this one.
I eat here once a week.
The food is always fresh, and consistent.
The staff is always warm, upbeat and friendly.
The owner Brian and his wife have a real grasp on the business and their customer service mimics any 5 star high end restaurant.
Love the warm family style atmosphere. Its always inviting and and never disappointing.
Try the specials, the homemade scratch chicken noodle soup, chicken and dumplings and chicken pot pie.
All to die for!!
Best breakfast in LV or the universe outside of my mother's kitchen.  Full house at lunch.  Excellent staff.  I recommend the Chicken Fried steak.

What a sad day. I have been bringing my family here for years. My daughters have known these waitresses since they were born. When Lou sold the place we didn't go as much, because the prices went up. We would still visit on occasion. When I would show up I was greeted by my first name and they always knew what I would eat. Today I met my wife and daughter there for breakfast. I didn't recognize the waitresses, which is no big deal. I waited for a much longer time than necessary for them to just ask me what I was drinking. We ordered our food and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited some more. People all around us were getting their food. People that showed up well after we ordered. After waiting for over 45 min, my wife, daughter and I left hungry and frustrated. It feels as though one of my favorite places has closed down for good, but the sad thing is that they are still open. 
I may try one last time before I give up for good, but a place that felt like visiting Grandma's house, is starting to feel like a chain restaurant where your nothing more than a unpaid bill.

Located on Decatur and feeding locals for decades under the watchful eye of its eponymous owner, Lou's Diner is the sort of place one could drive by one hundred times without even a second thought, and yet with prices a fraction of those just a few miles east plus the sort of old-timey service guaranteed to leave a smile on every face the spacious spot is perhaps the very definition of diamond in the rough.

Certainly not upscale, and not exactly sporting much curb appeal in the back of a complex near Arizona Charlies and the Charleston Antique Mall, a visit to Lou's Diner is the sort that starts with a bit of skepticism about what will be found inside, but greeted with warm smiles and walls decorated with every sort of nick-knack imaginable the scene unfolds much like any similar spot in middle America, though in this case several-fold cleaner with a specials board complimenting a well-culled menu of breakfasts, soups, sandwiches, and more.

Seating perhaps sixty, and soon to reach half-capacity about thirty minutes after a 6:45am arrival, it was after short perusal that decisions were made from the all-day options, and with jokes made that "you must real hungry" from the waitress it was with the second of about thirty coffee warm-ups that she departed, a curious Lou and her spouse stopping by inquisitively to ask why pictures were being taken before offering to lead me around the and show off the map of where all their visitors had come from - the wall of mismatched mugs belonging to "regulars" an appropriate amenity as nearly every other diner was greeted by name by the staff nearly the moment they opened the front door.

Ordering with a request for items to be brought as ready it would not be long before the Housemade Cinnamon Roll arrived beneath a ladle of of sweetened cream cheese, and with a core rife with cinnamon plus plenty of yeastiness acting to offset the richness the results spoke to old-school craftsmanship without a whole lot of fuss, a similar style employed in two desserts enjoyed later that day in the form of a moist lemon layer cake and banana cream pie that was unfortunately a bit short on fruit but still quite flavorful with a pudding base beneath a mountain of whipped cream.

Assuredly a place with skilled line-cooks, on this particular morning a trio working at great pace with plates coming through the window every couple minutes, course two arrived shortly after the last of the frosting was scraped from the cinnamon roll plate and quickly eschewing pseudo-syrup in favor of pure maple goodness brought from home the thin flapjacks proved fluffy and full of buttermilk while the Monte Cristo finally answered the question of where to find an authentic iteration in the (702) - each deep fried bite packed with ham and turkey bursting forth with flavor beneath two gooey cheeses, a powdered sugar sprinkling and spread of strawberry jam seeing the Diner-classic complete.

Easily overlooked in favor of familiar chains, local groups slowly expanding their brand, and fanciful new spots on The Strip, Lou's Diner is a throwback to 'greasy spoons' speckled across America - a place that feels familiar, friendly, and full of nostalgia with the sort of food that is at-worst straightforward, and otherwise genuinely delicious and authentic.

Really enjoyed this place. The prices are reasonable, and the food is delicious. We came here for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed it. Will definitely be coming back. It reminded me of an old style diner from back east and I thought it was pretty cute. They have a very good menu and you can pick and choose what you want with your entrees.
Great breakfast! Visiting Vegas w family. Enjoyed steak & eggs, blue berry pancakes and their shakes! Don't let the outside scare you away... Casual place in a small strip center. Friendly staff.

Wow Lou's diner is amazing! We were a party of 13, and all of us agreed that the food and service were great! I had a New York steak and it is probably the best New York steak I've had at a small diner also the best home fries. My sister didn't get to get one as they said they didn't have it thawed, but due to that inconvenience they gave her a free cinnamon roll, and she ordered something else. We thought we were going to have an unpleasant experience at first since my pregnant sister in law got flicked off while parking from someone coming out the diner for no reason other than probably us being Hispanic, but we were wrong! This place is great, 100% recommend!
Was at the dentist and was hungry so I went to this place cause I seen it had good Stars I had no idea how good the food was and the waitress Doreen was pretty cool.

This place truly is a dive. Don't let the TV show distort the meaning: dives are sh#@ holes. Place was filthy, had to wash my own fork with ice and a napkin before eating. Asked for an egg white omelet with extra crispy hashbrowns; Very bland eggs (it looked spiced but didn't taste like it, must have been old dried out spices that lost all flavor) and hashbrowns (obviously frozen) were still raw in the middle. Add in the decor looks like my great grandmother vomited the 50s all over the walls, and it was quite an unpleasant experience for me at least. The one redeeming quality (hence 2 stars not 1) was the wait staff were very nice, helped to sort out the menu for my mother who couldn't read the specials board, and the waitress was quick to refill drinks and bring over hot sauces to add on the food, which were desperately needed. I personally won't return, but my mother enjoyed it. Take the retiree's without taste buds here for a trip down memory lane. "Oh look, a rotary phone you talk into the wall with, we had one of those when gas was a nickel!" Sure ma.......Sure......

Our favorite family independently owned breakfast diner.  They take a personal interest in your satisfaction.   This country themed diner will fill you up without breaking your wallet.   They have tasty homemade jams too.

Its a dive. The decor hasnt been updated since it opened in 1969. The staff bend over backwards to help you and they know you by name. Food is served quick on cheap plastic plates. Oh, and its delicious and cheap! The owner visits each table and chats. 

It reminds me of Mels Diner on TV. This is how diners are suppose to be and used to be. Please stop by and treat yourself to Lous. Diners like this are disappearing from the American landscape.

GOOD FOOD - GOOD PRICES - GREAT SERVICE

Owner makes the raspberry jam fresh!  Full of locals with friendly service.  why eat on the strip...seriously I want this place in San Diego.   

I had to update.   Went back again this morning and food is still amazing.
Love this place! Great little diner with fresh homemade jam! Good prices, great food, friendly staff and owner...gem of a place!
This price overall is good. But way too slow to serve. They charge $2.25 for additional toasts

This place is a step back in time, with the dudads on the wall reminds me of my grandma's. 

The menu is breakfast and lunch, standards like sauage and eggs, country potatos or hash browns, toast or biscuit and gravy, and one my favs grits!  Lunch stuff like BLT, burgers and other sandwiches. 

We seated ourselves had someone taking our drink order as fast as that and they kept them full. My husband asked about menu items and was told they'll do it all anytime! 

We ordered breakfast today. My scrambled eggs came with country potatos bacon and grits love it with tuns of butter! 

Great sevice,  nice and clean, great menu!

Another great experience at Lou's Diner!!!!! Took my in-laws with us this time (they were looking forward to it because we've been talking this place up so much since the first time we came) and again they did not disappoint!  The place was packed (that's what happens when you have such an awesome place ) but we were still seated within minutes.  Brian, the owner, remembered us from our conversation last time, and even thanked me for the review (no need for thanks here- just writing an honest opinion about our experience but hey, you're welcome ).  He had us try some of their new HOMEMADE jam and it was DELICIOUS- (not too sweet)!  We ended up buying one of each: mixed berry, raspberry, and strawberry.   Didn't take pictures this time because I practically inhaled my food but I had "brad's burrito" and my husband had the veggie omelet. Thank you Lou's Diner for being so great.  If you want to enjoy a good homemade meal where everyone treats you like family- Lou's Diner is your spot.

Okay, first of all this place gets major props for being in the same spot for at least 30 years.  I am guessing on the amount of years but it is a long time.  Dare I say a "tradition" in Las Vegas...

Anywho.  I LOVE this place.  In fact it reminds me of home.  It reminds me of the local diner of yesteryear.  Try sitting in there facing the kitchen so you cannot see Decatur Blvd and you for get you are in Las Vegas!  I felt like I was sitting in a mom and pop joint in Idaho. (that's a good thing BTW).  This place has that mom and pop family restaurant charm to it with out even trying.  It is a real mom and pop joint.   

I ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs.  The chicken fried steak was out of sight!  It was crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside.  It was thinner than other chicken fried steaks but it was huge.  They might tenderize real well that makes it wider and thinner, but that is only speculation.  It was smothered with gravy.  

The eggs, and I have said this before, a good breakfast joint has to perfectly baste my eggs.  This place served perfectly basted eggs.  Almost... almost... not quite as good as my mom does... almost.  I had the home fries with breakfast.  They were good.  It was just all around good breakfast food.

The portion was huge.  The prices were low.  Great value here!

The service was good. The waitress wasn't exactly warm but she had the diner waitress attitude that is borderline curt but at the same time likably crusty.  Kinda like Tommy Lasorda.


Side notes
** parking is bad - extra parking in the back
**  Coffee was weak - next time I come throw an extra scoop in the hopper for me.

I've been in town for almost 30 years. About a month ago I finally came to Lou's. Now this is our 3rd visit here and we love it. Staff is always friendly and the food is phenomenal. Definitely go for breakfast at some point and get the home made jam. The only bad thing I can say about this place is that if you don't know it's there, you may pass right by it. It's tucked away a bit in a little plaza. But don't let anything deter you from coming in. 
Sit down for a while and enjoy your meal, the service and the atmosphere.

Well 5 stars don't always come easy but this was a slam dunk!! I have been looking for a place like this in Vegas. Old school diner style with great food and good prices. Friendly staff and very attentive. Can't wait to take other guests here.
Service and overall feeling of the restaurant was warm and comfortable. Corned beef hash and eggs were great. Check it out!

when we asked where the locals eat, this is where we were directed to go. this place has ambience and history....pictures of outlaws and law men, like Doc Holliday and Jesse James, old time actors like Jimmy Dean and Victor Mature. the restaurant has the feel of gramma's kitchen and the owner remembers the names of the regulars. they bake their own pies and cakes and even got the whole restaurant involved in singing happy birthday to a 97 year old patron. its good, highly recommended!

When we walked in at 10:45am, this place was packed, we seated ourselfs and we were quickly brought menus and our drink orders were taken. Waitress came a couple minutes after we got our drinks. She said it was very busy for a Monday at this time.  So far so good, then,,,we waited and waited,  20 minutes.  The wait was really no problem as all the food coming out looks great, but,,,we had to keep flagging down (which I hate having to do) in order to get coffee and ice tea refills.  The food finally came, nacho, eggs benedict, eggs were perfect, hollandaise was perfect and the potatoes were nice and crisp.  I loved my open face turkey, but, I really felt it could have been a lot hotter. Uriel got the tenders and fries but for 9.99 and only 2 pieces it was was overpriced.  We will Def com back here and look forward to trying out some other items.

Love coming here it is like going to your grandmas house on a Sunday morning for breakfast! TRY THE SWEET CREAM PANCAKES!!!!!!!!!!! They are to die for! It feels like the food is homemade..tastes fresh! Also the servers are very attentive and nice even when it's busy, I've never had a problem getting a table! So tasty! I've been here many times and it's always the same thing, perfect!
Excelent food and service  grest eggs and hash brown. Good for a classic american breakfast.

Great food at a great price. This is am amazing little diner! The coffee is great and the service is on point! The owner works the front. So its made personal, which is hard to find here in Las Vegas! Another cool thing is they allow you to leave your own coffee cup for when you come back. Great experience!

I've been on a mission to find new restaurants in town. Tried this place and I have to say it's one of the best I've had the joy of visiting. Service was excellent fast and very attentive. Food hash and eggs was excellent. Would recommend this place to everyone. Great Job!!!!
Best breakfast I have ever had in Las Vegas. Family friendly dinner . The Sevice is fast and the selections are numerous. Owner is vary friendly and concerned about his customers satisfaction!

I'm really not a morning or breakfast person, but this place won me over.  Everything is home made, and it shows.  Standouts are the cinnamon roll and home made jams.  If I had to take any points off, I'd be the watered down coffee.

Go try this place!f

Just a great place!! Feels like home here! The owner Bryan is so great and he makes the homemade jam! AMAZING! And of course great staff they all took care of me! Went here for Breakfast alone but sure didn't feel alone! I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas!

Great comfortable place.  Great food, atmosphere, pricing and service! Wish there was one in SLV/Henderson. 
Oh, homemade jams are great!!
Park yourself, grab a vessel of caffeine, get your paper and energy plate.  Delicious food, diner style and the coffee scent of the old school diner rips you to heaven.

Just stayed in Vegas for 7 days, that's right, 7 whole days in Vegas and went to Lou's every single morning. It's fantastic diner food at criminally low prices, and a nice reminder that there's more to Las Vegas than The Strip. The husband and wife that own the place are unbelievably friendly and will do everything they can to make your dining experience great. Highly recommend the Curtis' Stack as the biscuits and gravy are unreal. Can't see myself eating breakfast anywhere and highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

Any restaurant that offers playdough for the kids while they wait deserves 5 stars! 

Lou's is wonderful. A total old timers little diner. Prices are still ridiculously cheap and the coffee is hot and strong, and homemade jam!! Not much more you can ask for!
